metadata.name: ReFi Cape Town | Tokenised Impacts Hackathon
metadata.description: The ReFi Cape Town Hackathon ran from the 7th-9th of September 2024. Participation was open to young software developers, sustainability enthusiasts, and activists. There were 38 individuals from 13 teams who participated. Submissions were accepted virtually and ZAR 20,000 of bounties were distributed to winners. The event was convened by Shawn Alimohammadi from IXO. Grant funding was received through GitCoin Beta through the ReFi Local Nodes round, sponsored by the Climate Collective and Celo. Alwyn van wyk (IXO & Younglings Africa0 and Kristina Zittel (UNICEF-SA) led a workshop on the Impact Economy and Youth-led Solutions to Climate Change.
